descript.abstract: The active tax parcel boundaries for all of Tompkins County for a given year. The boundaries represent the one-to-one match with the parcel boundaries shown on the final paper maps for a given year.
descript.purpose: The parcel boundaries represent legal descriptions of property ownership, as recorded in various public documents in the Tompkins County Clerk's Office. This is the database of property ownership and information in Tompkins County, as mandated by New York State. This database can be related to the New York State Office of Real Property Services (RPS) database extract using either the SWISPRINTK field or the PARCELKEY field.
descript.supplinf: Properties that are tracked by an account number (utilities, railroads, etc.) may be shown as several separate tax parcel boundaries, with different tax map print keys, even though they are tracked in the RPS database under the same account number and treated as one single parcel. The parcel region will show these account-number properties as one tax parcel boundary, while the printkey region will show each separate tax parcel boundary that is a part of the account number. As of 2005, the tax parcel boundaries have not been edge-matched by municipality, except for Villages within their respective Town. This data set is derived from the tax parcel region of all tax parcel data sets in Tompkins County and is maintained as a geodatabase featureclass by municipality. For property ownership information please contact the Tompkins County Assessment Department.

status.update: Continually, with new versions published annually, each July 1

idinfo.useconst: The following statement must be included with any products that use or are derived from this data set: Data contained in this product was originally produced by the Tompkins County ITS GIS Division and the Tompkins County Assessment Department and may not be reproduced or redistributed without the express written consent of the originators. The originators do not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information portrayed by the data. The data contained herein is for visualization purposes only and cannot be used for conveyance. Property boundaries are based on legal documents, aerial photos, software interpolation, and registration to the 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Files and, therefore, may differ from legal property descriptions. For complete legal descriptions and conveyance, please refer to the appropriate deeds, surveys, and other legal documents.
idinfo.datacred: Tompkins County ITS GIS Division and Tompkins County Assessment Department
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

citeinfo.title: Standard GIS Extract of Real Property Services Data - 2005
citeinfo.othercit: Tompkins County ITS GIS Division is responsible for creating the extract and converting it to a format that is compatible with the County's GIS.

citeinfo.title: Tompkins County Real Property Services (RPS) Database
citeinfo.othercit: The New York State Office of Real Property Services (RPS) database extract can be related using either the SWISPRINTK field or the PARCELKEY field.

dataqual.logic: The taxparcel region from each municipality's tax map data set is appended into one County-wide data set. This data set's topology is created real-time using ArcGIS map and geodatabase topology rules, then converted to an ArcView shapefile. All error checking is done in the source data sets.
dataqual.complete: Complete parcels for the entire County.

horizpa.horizpar: Varies, depending on source of parcel boundary (survey, deed, aerial photo, raw conversion from paper maps). The accuracy of the data set is limited to the accuracy of the 1991 Tompkins County Planimetric Base Map series.

vertacc.vertaccr: The accuracy of the data set is limited to the accuracy of the 1991 Tompkins County Planimetric Base Map series.

procstep.procdesc: Tax parcel boundaries were initially maintained manually on mylar originals, using erasable ink. In 1991, a series of planimetric base data sets were produced from aerial photography, and are now referred to as the 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Base Map. The tax parcel mylar maps were digitized using MapGrafix and referenced to the 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Base Map. In 1997, the MapGrafix data sets for the City of Ithaca and the Towns of Caroline and Danby were approved by the New York State Office of Real Property Services (NYS ORPS). In 1998, the Map Grafix data sets were converted to Arc/Info for the City of Ithaca, Towns of Caroline, Danby, Dryden, and Ithaca, and the Villages of Cayuga Heights, Dryden, and Freeville. In 1999, the Towns of Enfield, Groton, Lansing, Newfield, and Ulysses, and the Villages of Groton, Lansing, and Trumansburg were converted to Arc/Info. Beginning with the 1999 tax year, all tax parcel boundaries were maintained in Arc/Info, all tax maps are printed using ArcView, and all tax maps are archived digitally using Adobe Acrobat, as well as the traditional paper archival. During the transition period from paper to digital maps, parcel boundaries were approximated, except for those boundaries that have been input using paper surveys and legal descriptions. The tax parcel data sets consisted of three groups of layers: boundary layers, text layers, and region layers. The boundary layers consisted of those Arc/Info feature classes upon which the region layers are created. Boundary layers include the nodes, arcs, and polygons. Parcel boundaries are changed by first modifying the arc and node layers, and updating the arc attributes. Next, the polygons were re-created and their attributes were updated. The text layers were then updated to reflect the boundary changes. Finally, the regions were created from the polygons using polygon attributes and the Arc/Info REGIONDISSOLVE command. The text layers are Arc/Info annotation layers and include acreage, block, dimension, non-roll section 1 (exempt/utility/state lands), lot, Military Tract/Watkins and Flint Purchase, municipality, place, road name, special district, tax map, tic mark, and water text, as it appears on the printed tax parcel maps. The region layers include deed book/page, municipal, parcel, printkey, and tax map regions. The printkey regions from each of the municipal data sets for the current tax year are then combined into a county-wide data set, which is then converted to an ArcView shapefile. Regions for special districts were derived from polygon attributes in the same manner as the other regions, for each municipality, then combined into a County-wide special districts data set. Regions for public lands were similiarly combined and converted into a County-wide public lands data set. In 2004, the original Arc/Info coverages described above were migrated to the ESRI ArcInfo Desktop geodatabase format. Parcel boundaries are changed based on deed and survey information and are modified in the software using Map topology and several geodatabase topology rules to ensure spatial data integrity. All regions, annotations, centroids and polygons listed above were sussessfully migrated by municipality and are maintained in the ESRI personal geodatabase format. Beginning with the 2004 tax year, all tax parcel boundaries are maintained in ArcInfo Desktop, all tax maps are printed via a special script which outputs the taxmaps to Adobe Acrobat (PDF) format. All tax maps are archived digitally using Adobe Acrobat, as well as the traditional paper archival. 2005 tax maps in the Adobe PDF format can be obtained digitally online at: <http://www.co.tompkins.ny.us/gis/maps/tax.html>.

attr.attrdef: Real Property Services (RPS) Database parcel key (Swis-Section-Block-Lot or SSBL). This field is updated yearly based on the GIS extract of the final-roll RPS database. This field can be used to relate to the RPS database.

Concatenation of SWIS code, "-", and the PRINTKEY field, for those polygons without an account number (ie, a blank ACCOUNTNUM), or a concatenation of SWIS code, "-", and the ACCOUNTNUM field (at least for some polygons with an account number). This field is easily reproducible within the Real Property Services database extract, and is used as the primary relate (key) field to the RPS extract from the parcel data sets. This field is used to create the Print Key region in this data set.
State SWIS code for the municipality in which the parcel is located. (Not necessarily the same as the SWIS code in which the polygon is located)

attr.attrdef: Real Property Services database print key (Section-Block-Lot, or S-B-L).

Real Property Services (RPS) Database account number, which is used to uniquely identify railroad, state-owned, and utility properties. The original values were extracted directly from the RPS database. This field was updated automatically in the past when the region layers were created using the PARCREGS.aml Macro.
Length of perimeter, in U.S. survey feet
Area, in square U.S. survey feet
Real Property Services (RPS) acreage, extracted from the RPS database. This acreage will reflect the total acreage of the parcel, which is not necessarily the same area as the polygon.

distinfo.distliab: Cornell University provides these geographic data "as is". Cornell University makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. Cornell University further makes no warranty either expressed or implied, regarding the condition of the product or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these files have been processed successfully on computers at Cornell University, no warranty is made by Cornell University regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.

The tax parcel data set and any products derived from it represents a compilation of graphical and textual information from deeds and surveys, hand-drawn mylar maps, a digitial planimetric base map, various paper and digital aerial photographs, and digital conversion of hand-drawn mylar maps. Errors and omissions can occur from each of these sources, as each source represents a large number of records and originators of information. As a practical matter, Tompkins County does not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information portrayed. The end user of the data sets and products derived from them agrees to accept the data "as is", with the full knowledge that errors and omissions may exist. The end user further agrees to hold harmless Tompkins County for any liability or damages that may result from an improper or inappropriate use of the data.

stdorder.nondig: Paper maps, either color or black and white, available on 11"x17" 28lb paper or on 24"x36" coated inkjet paper. Maps are also available on special media and at different print sizes, by request.
stdorder.fees: Half-size (11"x17") color maps are $2.00 each. Half-size black and white maps are $0.50 each. Full-size (24"x36") color and black and white maps are $4.00 each on coated paper. Fees for special-request media or non-standard print sizes will vary.
stdorder.ordering: Submit a written request to the Tompkins County Assessment Department. Specify the municipality, map number(s), media type, print size, and color or black and white.
stdorder.turnarnd: Half-size maps: 3-4 days. Full-size maps: 5-10 days.

offoptn.offmedia: Zip disk, CD-ROM, floppy disk, etc.

stdorder.fees: The cost of reproduction for a standard data set, which varies depending on the type of media requested (zip disk, CD-ROM, floppy diskette, etc.). A standard data set is an ESRI shapefile, ArcGIS feature class, ArcView shapefile, Dbase III database, or Microsoft Access database. Official tax maps are available in Adobe Acrobat format, organized by municipality. Custom data sets or file types will incur additional labor costs.
stdorder.ordering: Submit a written request to the Tompkins County ITS GIS Division.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
